alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 8:12PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Haskell, northeastern Latimer and northern Le Flore Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 811 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Red Oak to 2 miles northwest of Wister. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Poteau... Panama... Wister... Mccurtain... Bokoshe... Cameron... Mc Curtain... Shady Point... Rock Island... Milton... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Arkansas...and southeastern Oklahoma.
